your periods again or if 
you are breastfeeding. It is 
therefore important to use 
contraceptives as soon as you 
start having sex again.
Your midwife or doctor 
should talk to you about 
contraception before you 
leave hospital and again when 
you go for your six-week 
postnatal check. Alternatively, 
you could talk to your midwife 
or health visitor when they visit 
at home or go to your GP or 
family planning clinic.
For further information about 
methods of contraception
visit www.sex
